/home/mgh/LanlGeoMag/libLanlGeoMag/Lgm_SimplifiedMead.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* Copyright (c) 2008 Michael G. Henderson <mghenderson@lanl.gov>
00002  *
00003  * Permission to use, copy, modify, distribute, and sell this software and its
00004  * documentation for any purpose is hereby granted without fee, provided that
00005  * the above copyright notice appear in all copies and that both that
00006  * copyright notice and this permission notice appear in supporting
00007  * documentation.  No representations are made about the suitability of this
00008  * software for any purpose.  It is provided "as is" without express or
00009  * implied warranty.
00010  *
00011  *
00012  *
00013  *  The "Simplified Mead" field derived in Shultz and Lanzerotti (see equations 1.44-1.45))
00014  *
00015  *
00016  */
00017 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00018 
00019 /*
00020  *
00021  *  User Selectable Parameters:
00022  *          SW pressure
00023  *
00024  */
00025 int Lgm_SimplifiedMead(Lgm_Vector *v, Lgm_Vector *B, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info) {
00026 
00027     double      x_sm, y_sm, z_sm;
00028     double      r, theta, phi;
00029     Lgm_Vector  Bsm;
00030     double      B_r, B_theta, B_phi;
00031     double      B0, B1, B2, Bt, b, b2, b3, b4;
00032     double      M, r2, r3;
00033     double      cp, sp, ct, st;
00034 
00035     M = Info->c->M_cd;
00036     B0 = Info->B0 * M;
00037     B1 = Info->B1 * M;                  // See page 30 of Schultz and Lanzerotti, [1974]
00038     B2 = sqrt(3.0) * Info->B2 * M;  // See page 30 of Schultz and Lanzerotti, [1974]
00039 
00040     /*
00041      *  compute SM coords from GSM coords
00042      */
00043     x_sm = v->x*Info->c->cos_psi - v->z*Info->c->sin_psi;
00044     y_sm = v->y;
00045     z_sm = v->x*Info->c->sin_psi + v->z*Info->c->cos_psi;
00046 
00047 
00048     /*
00049      *  convert x_sm, y_sm, and, z_sm to spherical coords.
00050      */
00051     r     = sqrt(x_sm*x_sm + y_sm*y_sm + z_sm*z_sm);
00052     phi   = atan2(y_sm, x_sm);
00053     theta = acos(z_sm / r);
00054 
00055     /*
00056      *  compute b, the standoff distance
00057      *
00058      *  At subsolar point, Ps = Pb 
00059      *  where Ps = nmv^2
00060      *  and Pb = B^2/2mu0
00061      *
00062      *  For this simple model, B at subsolar (i.e. at r=b) is:
00063      *      B = Btheta = -(M + B1 + B2)/b^3
00064      *  Balancing Pb with Psw gives:
00065      *  
00066      *          (  (M+B1+B2)^2  ) (1/6)
00067      *      b = ( --------------)
00068      *          (  2 mu0 Ps     )
00069      *
00070      *  If M+B1+B2 is in nT and Ps is in nPa, then:
00071      *
00072      *          (  3.9788736e-4 * (M+B1+B2)^2  ) (1/6)
00073      *      b = ( ---------------------------- )
00074      *          (               Ps             )
00075      *  
00076      *   Note that eqn 1.43 in Schultz and Lanzerotti, [1974], is for the full Mead field.
00077      *   we can probably use either one though???
00078      */
00079     Bt = B0+B1+B2;
00080     b = pow( 3.9788736e-4 * Bt*Bt / Info->P, 1.0/6.0 );
00081     b = 1.068*pow( 3.9788736e-4 * B0*B0/Info->P, 1.0/6.0); //eqn (1.43)
00082 //printf("B0, B1, B2, Psw, Bt, b = %g, %g, %g, %g, %g, %g\n", B0, B1, B2, Info->P, Bt, b);
00083     b2 = b*b;
00084     b3 = b*b2;
00085     b4 = b2*b2;
00086     
00087 
00088 
00089     /*
00090      *  compute centered dipole field in spherical coords
00091      *  i.e. (B_r, B_theta, B_phi). In Schultz and Lanzerotti, [1974],
00092      *  Phi is measured from midnight. Here its from noon.
00093      */
00094     r2       = r*r;
00095     r3       = r*r2;
00096     cp       = cos( phi );
00097     sp       = sin( phi );
00098     ct       = cos( theta );
00099     st       = sin( theta );
00100     B_r      = -2.0*B0*ct/r3 + 2.0*B1*ct/b3 + 2.0*B2*r*ct*st*cp/b4;
00101     B_phi    = -B2*r*ct*sp/b4;
00102     B_theta  = -1.0*B0*st/r3 - B1*st/b3 - B2*r*(2.0*st*st-1.0)*cp/b4;
00103 //printf("r = %g\n", r);
00104 
00105 
00106     /*
00107      *   Transform (B_r, B_theta, B_phi) -> (B_xsm, B_ysm, B_zsm)  (still SM)
00108      */
00109     Bsm.x = B_r*st*cp + B_theta*ct*cp;
00110     Bsm.y = B_r*st*sp + B_theta*ct*sp;
00111     Bsm.z = B_r*ct    - B_theta*st;
00112 
00113 
00114     /*
00115      *  Transform (B_xsm, B_ysm, B_zsm) -> (B_x, B_y, B_z) i.e. trans. to GSM
00116      */
00117     B->x =  Bsm.x*Info->c->cos_psi + Bsm.z*Info->c->sin_psi;
00118     B->y =  Bsm.y;
00119     B->z = -Bsm.x*Info->c->sin_psi + Bsm.z*Info->c->cos_psi;
00120 
00121     return(1);
00122 
00123 
00124 }
